name: Data from Cloud Storage
description:
Adversaries may access data from improperly secured cloud storage.

Many cloud service providers offer solutions for online data object storage such as Amazon S3, Azure Storage, and Google Cloud Storage. These solutions differ from other storage solutions (such as SQL or Elasticsearch) in that there is no overarching application. Data from these solutions can be retrieved directly using the cloud provider's APIs. 

In other cases, SaaS application providers such as Slack, Confluence, and Salesforce also provide cloud storage solutions as a peripheral use case of their platform. These cloud objects can be extracted directly from their associated application.(Citation: EA Hacked via Slack - June 2021)(Citation: SecureWorld - How Secure Is Your Slack Channel - Dec 2021)(Citation: HackerNews - 3 SaaS App Cyber Attacks - April 2022)(Citation: Dark Clouds_Usenix_Mulazzani_08_2011)

Adversaries may collect sensitive data from these cloud storage solutions. Providers typically offer security guides to help end users configure systems, though misconfigurations are a common problem.(Citation: Amazon S3 Security, 2019)(Citation: Microsoft Azure Storage Security, 2019)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage Best Practices, 2019) There have been numerous incidents where cloud storage has been improperly secured, typically by unintentionally allowing public access to unauthenticated users, overly-broad access by all users, or even access for any anonymous person outside the control of the Identity Access Management system without even needing basic user permissions.

This open access may expose various types of sensitive data, such as credit cards, personally identifiable information, or medical records.(Citation: Trend Micro S3 Exposed PII, 2017)(Citation: Wired Magecart S3 Buckets, 2019)(Citation: HIPAA Journal S3 Breach, 2017)(Citation: Rclone-mega-extortion_05_2021)

Adversaries may also obtain then abuse leaked credentials from source repositories, logs, or other means as a way to gain access to cloud storage objects.

x_mitre_detection: Monitor for unusual queries to the cloud provider's storage service. Activity originating from unexpected sources may indicate improper permissions are set that is allowing access to data. Additionally, detecting failed attempts by a user for a certain object, followed by escalation of privileges by the same user, and access to the same object may be an indication of suspicious activity.

mitigates.name: User Account Management
mitigates.description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.

mitigates.name: Encrypt Sensitive Information
mitigates.description: Protect sensitive information with strong encryption.

mitigates.name: Restrict File and Directory Permissions
mitigates.description: Restrict access by setting directory and file permissions that are not specific to users or privileged accounts.

mitigates.name: Filter Network Traffic
mitigates.description: Use network appliances to filter ingress or egress traffic and perform protocol-based filtering. Configure software on endpoints to filter network traffic.

mitigates.name: Audit
mitigates.description: Perform audits or scans of systems, permissions, insecure software, insecure configurations, etc. to identify potential weaknesses.

mitigates.name: Multi-factor Authentication
mitigates.description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to authenticate to a system; such as username and password in addition to a token from a physical smart card or token generator.

requirements.description: Ensure that permissions on a cloud storage are checked regularly to ensure proper permissions are set to deny open or unprivileged access to resources.
Ensure that data stored at rest in cloud storage are encrypted.
Ensure that managed encryption keys are rotated by providers.
Ensure that an incident response plan is in place for storage breach which includes rotating the keys and test for impact on client applications
Ensure that IP allows listing along with the user account management is implemented to ensure that data access is restricted not only to valid users.

Ensure that IP allows listing along with the user account management is implemented to ensure that data access is allowed only from expected IP ranges to mitigate the use of stolen credentials to access data.
Ensure that multi-factor authentication is implemented to restrict access to resources and cloud storage APIs.
Ensure that access control lists are implemented for storage systems and objects.
Ensure that user permissions groups and roles are configured to manage access to cloud storage
Ensure that strict Identity and Access Management (IAM) controls are implemented to prevent access to storage solutions if not required.
Ensure that temporary access tokens are issued(rather than permanent credentials), to entities outside of the internal security boundary
Ensure that the cloud provider's storage service should be monitored for unusual queries.
Ensure that activity should be monitored if originating from unexpected sources since it may indicate that improper permissions are set which allows access to data.
Ensure that failed attempts by a user for a certain object followed by an escalation of privileges by the same user, and access to the same object should be monitored to identify suspicious activity.
